newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB says sees 97/98 operating profit at 65 bln yen.
newsitem.headline: NCB says sees 97/98 operating profit at 65 bln yen.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) said it expects to post a parent operating profit of 65 billion yen in the current business year to March 31, 1998, compared with 170.16 billion yen in fiscal 1996/97.
The forecast was revealed by a senior NCB official after the bank announced its results for 1996/97.
The official also said the bank expects the yield gap between NCB debentures and those of other banks to stabilise in the next few months.
The official said the 65 billion yen forecast for parent operating profit for 1997/98 is based on a possible increase in Japan's official discount rate.
"Our forecast is based on the possibility of a rate hike in the latter half of this year," he said.

The operating profit forecast does not take into account any profits from bond dealings, so the forecast will be revised upward at the end of 1997/98 if profits are made from the bank's bond dealings, he added.
He said the value of NCB's total debenture issues fell by about 1.2 trillion yen in 1996/97.
